outputs.output_descr: The Access to Renewable Energy Project aims to expand access to renewable energy services accessible to Small and Medium Scale Enterprises byfacilitating renewable energy investments and increase finance options for renewable energy uptake. Under the project, UNDP supports in developing the capacity and knowledge of financial institutions, and energy service providers, government, MSMEs and other relevant stakeholders to invest in and improved access to reliable and renewable energy service options available for MSMEs and rural use. This support also includes promotion of policies and institutional frameworks that will encourage inclusive renewable energy market development.

The Access to Renewable Energy Project aims to expand access to renewable energy services accessible to MSMEs by facilitating renewable energy investments and increase finance options for renewable energy uptake. Under the project, UNDP supports in developing the capacity and knowledge of financial institutions, and energy service providers,  MSMEs and other relevant stakeholders  at the State Governments level to invest in and improved access to reliable and renewable energy service options available for Small and Medium scale enterprises an rural use. This support also includes promotion of policies and institutional frameworks that will encourage inclusive renewable energy market development.

Facility for Inclusive Markets will provide knowledge and analysis on the engagement of poor and vulnerable groups in the economic process, focussing at states level.
Key strategies include: 
-Assessment and planning for the development of value chains for one or two products 
-Capacity Development Programme to enhance entrepreneurship skills initiated and first set of partnerships agreed and completed

An expanded base of private sector-based service providers targeting business and market development for Medium, Small and Micro Enterprises, particularly through inclusive finance and entrepreneurship training at the federal level. Project aims at increasing the number of SME operators able to use expanded access to finance to build knowledge, skills and systems, increase productivity and generate higher returns on investment.

An expanded base of private sector-based service providers targeting business and market development for Medium, Small and Micro Enterprises, particularly through inclusive finance and entrepreneurship training at the states level. Project aims at increasing the number of SME operators able to use expanded access to finance to build knowledge, skills and systems, increase productivity and generate higher returns on investment.

Facility for Inclusive Markets seeks to catalyse the rapid scalling up of positive experiences of inclusive market approaches exercised by private and public players through advocacy alliances, knowledge management, capacity building and research.Major outputs are: Improved/expanded value chains in agriculture and agro-industry, including through innovative coorporate social responsibilty from the private sectorto meet demand in domestic, regional or international markets whilst boosting productivity, value addition, employment and incomes especially in rural and peri-urban areas

Key outputs include: Developed and/or expanded value chains in agriculture and agro-industry, including through innovative corporate social responsibility to meet demand in domestic, regional or international markets whilst boosting productivity, value addition, employment and incomes especially in rural and peri-urban areas.

project_descr: To stimulate sustainable private sector led growth that benefits the poor in Nigeria
